section.title: Eulerian cycles and paths
section.para: These functions calculate whether an Eulerian path or cycle exists and if so, can find them.

section.title: igraph_is_eulerian — Checks whether an eulerian path or cycle exists.

listitem.para: Pointer to a Boolean, will be set to true if a path exists.
Pointer to a Boolean, will be set to true if a cycle exists.
Error code: IGRAPH_ENOMEM, not enough memory for temporary data.

section.para: Time complexity: O(|V|+|E|), the number of vertices times the number of edges.

section.title: igraph_eulerian_cycle — Finds an Eulerian cycle
section.para: Finds an Eulerian cycle, if it exists. An Eulerian cycle is a closed path that traverses each edge precisely once.

listitem.para: Pointer to an initialised vector. The indices of edges belonging to the cycle will be stored here.

Error code:
IGRAPH_ENOMEM
not enough memory for temporary data.
IGRAPH_EINVVID
graph does not have an Eulerian cycle.

section.para: Time complexity: O(|V||E|), the number of vertices times the number of edges.

section.title: igraph_eulerian_path — Finds an Eulerian path
section.para: Finds an Eulerian path, if it exists. An Eulerian path traverses each edge precisely once.

listitem.para: Pointer to an initialised vector. The indices of edges belonging to the path will be stored here.

Error code:
IGRAPH_ENOMEM
not enough memory for temporary data.
IGRAPH_EINVVID
graph does not have an Eulerian path.

section.para: Time complexity: O(|V||E|), the number of vertices times the number of edges.
